info.title: FHIR Immunization resource API documentation
info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.

get.description:
Returns Immunizations based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for Immunization.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Vaccination  (non)-Administration Date. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: dose-sequence
parameters.description: Dose number within series

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Business identifier

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The service delivery location or facility in which the vaccine was / was to be administered

parameters.name: lot-number
parameters.description: Vaccine Lot Number

parameters.name: manufacturer
parameters.description: Vaccine Manufacturer

parameters.name: notgiven
parameters.description: Administrations which were not given

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient for the vaccination record

parameters.name: performer
parameters.description: The practitioner who administered the vaccination

parameters.name: reaction
parameters.description: Additional information on reaction

parameters.name: reaction-date
parameters.description: When reaction started. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Why immunization occurred

parameters.name: reason-not-given
parameters.description: Explanation of reason vaccination was not administered

parameters.name: requester
parameters.description: The practitioner who ordered the vaccination

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Immunization event status

parameters.name: vaccine-code
parameters.description: Vaccine Product Administered

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing Immunization based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.
